pageContext.claim: “In 2018, American energy exports alone brought down our trade deficit by $215 billion. And we're pursuing a vision not just of energy independence but of American energy dominance.”
pageContext.analysis: Without energy exports, the trade deficit would been $188 billion (not $215 billion) greater. Still, those exports didn't "bring the trade deficit down." It grew in 2018, according to the Bureau of Economic Analysis.
